entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin articulus joint, division, diminutive of artus joint, limb; akin to Greek arariskein to fit arm

def.dt: :a distinct often numbered section of a writing
:a stipulation in a document (as a contract or a creed) articles of indenture
:a nonfictional prose composition usually forming an independent part of a publication (as a magazine)
:any of a small set of words or affixes (as a, an, and the) used with nouns to limit or give definiteness to the application
:a member of a class of things
:an item of goods articles of value
:a thing or person of a particular and distinctive kind or class the genuine article
